com.vaadin.addon.charts
Class Chart

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.server.AbstractClientConnector
      com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
          com.vaadin.addon.charts.Chart
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, Serializable
public class Chart
extends com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent

Chart is a Vaadin component that is used to visualize data.

All configuration and data is given through a Configuration object. Here is a simple usage example: 

 Chart chart = new Chart(ChartType.COLUMN);
 Configuration conf = chart.getConfiguration();
 conf.setTitle("My data visualized");
 ListSeries series = new ListSeries("Diameters");
 series.setData(4900,  12100,  12800,
                6800,  143000, 125000,
                51100, 49500);
 conf.addSeries(series);

Unless otherwise documented, dynamic changes to the chart configuration are not immediately reflected to an already drawn component. To redraw the chart you should call drawChart() or drawChart(Configuration).

The implementation relies on the HighCharts JS library. Developers can also use its raw JS API via the drawChart(String) method.

See more examples in Book of Vaadin or the online demos.

See Also:
Book of Vaadin, Vaadin Charts, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Chart

public Chart()
Constructs a chart component with default settings.

Default dimensions are 100% width and 400px height.

Chart

public Chart(ChartType type)
Constructs a chart with the specified default chart type.

In charts with multiple series, the type can also be defined by setting series specific plot options.

Parameters:
type - the ChartType
See Also:
Chart(), AbstractSeries.setPlotOptions(com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.AbstractPlotOptions)

drawChart

public void drawChart(String jsonConfig)
Draws chart with the given configuration. The configuration is given in Highcharts configuration format (JavaScript) and it overrides settings done via the standard Configuration object.

Although using strictly typed Java API (via getConfiguration() is highly encouraged, using the low level Highcharts configuration may be handy in some occasions.

Note, that this configuration is evaluated as JavaScript and the config may contain JavaScript functions. Thus developers should pay attention to data that is passed to this function.

Note, that if further modifications are done to the configuration, the method must be called again to redraw the UI.

Parameters:
jsonConfig - the chart configuration as a JSON string
See Also:
getConfiguration(), drawChart(Configuration)

getJsonConfig

public String getJsonConfig()
Returns:
the Highcharts compatible JSON configuration of the chart.
See Also:
drawChart(String)

getConfiguration

public Configuration getConfiguration()
Returns:
the chart configuration that is used for this chart
See Also:
drawChart(Configuration)

drawChart

public void drawChart(Configuration configuration)
Draws a chart with the given configuration as a starting point.

Note that if you modify the underlying Series directly the chart will automatically be updated to reflect this unless explicitly told not to. The methods listed below can be used as an example.

Parameters:
configuration -
See Also:
DataSeries.add(com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.DataSeriesItem), DataSeries#addData(com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.DataSeriesItem, boolean), DataSeries#removeData(com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.DataSeriesItem), DataSeries#updateData(com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.DataSeriesItem)

addChartSelectionListener

public void addChartSelectionListener(ChartSelectionListener listener)
Adds a chart selection listener

Note that if a chart selection listener is set, default action for selection is prevented. Most commonly this means that client side zoom doesn't work and you are responsible for setting the zoom, etc in the listener implementation.

Parameters:
listener -

removeChartSelectionListener

public void removeChartSelectionListener(ChartSelectionListener listener)
Removes a chart selection listener.

Parameters:
listener -
See Also:

setJsonConfig

public void setJsonConfig(String jsonConf)
